title: 'Over 50% polling stations centres': How Bangladesh is preparing for first election since Hasina ouster
summary_full: Bangladesh is holding parliamentary elections amidst unprecedented security following the ouster of former PM Sheikh Hasina. Over half of polling centres are deemed risk-prone, prompting a massive deployment of nearly 9.58 lakh security personnel. For the first time, drones and body-worn cameras will monitor the process, aiming for a peaceful transition after the Hasina era.
